name: Travel Planning Agents (2)

node.description: Get chat inputs from the Playground.

code.name: code
code.value:
from axiestudio.base.data.utils import IMG_FILE_TYPES, TEXT_FILE_TYPES
from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import BoolInput
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, FileInput, MessageTextInput, MultilineInput, Output
from axiestudio.memory import store_message
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.utils.constants import MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_USER, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER


class ChatInput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Input"
    description = "Get chat inputs from the Playground."
    icon = "ChatInput"
    name = "ChatInput"

    inputs = [
        MultilineInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            value="",
            info="Message to be passed as input.",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="should_store_message",
            display_name="Store Messages",
            info="Store the message in the history.",
            value=True,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=[MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER],
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_USER,
            info="Type of sender.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name",
            display_name="Sender Name",
            info="Name of the sender.",
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_USER,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id",
            display_name="Session ID",
            info="The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        FileInput(
            name="files",
            display_name="Files",
            file_types=TEXT_FILE_TYPES + IMG_FILE_TYPES,
            info="Files to be sent with the message.",
            advanced=True,
            is_list=True,
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Message", name="message", method="message_response"),
    ]

    def message_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
            sender=self.sender,
            sender_name=self.sender_name,
            session_id=self.session_id,
            files=self.files,
        )

        if (
            self.session_id
            and isinstance(message, Message)
            and isinstance(message.text, str)
            and self.should_store_message
        ):
            store_message(
                message,
                flow_id=self.graph.flow_id,
            )
            self.message.value = message

        self.status = message
        return message

files.info: Files to be sent with the message.
files.name: files

input_value.info: Message to be passed as input.
input_value.name: input_value
input_value.value: Create a travel itinerary for a trip from São Paulo to Uberlândia, MG on August 23, 2024. The traveler enjoys drinking beer, eating pão de queijo, and drinking special coffee.

session_id.info: The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.
session_id.name: session_id

should_store_message.info: Store the message in the history.
should_store_message.name: should_store_message

node.description: Display a chat message in the Playground.

code.name: code
code.value:
from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import BoolInput
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.memory import store_message
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.utils.constants import MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER


class ChatOutput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Output"
    description = "Display a chat message in the Playground."
    icon = "ChatOutput"
    name = "ChatOutput"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            info="Message to be passed as output.",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="should_store_message",
            display_name="Store Messages",
            info="Store the message in the history.",
            value=True,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=[MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER],
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_AI,
            advanced=True,
            info="Type of sender.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name",
            display_name="Sender Name",
            info="Name of the sender.",
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_AI,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id",
            display_name="Session ID",
            info="The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="data_template",
            display_name="Data Template",
            value="{text}",
            advanced=True,
            info="Template to convert Data to Text. If left empty, it will be dynamically set to the Data's text key.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Message", name="message", method="message_response"),
    ]

    def message_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
            sender=self.sender,
            sender_name=self.sender_name,
            session_id=self.session_id,
        )
        if (
            self.session_id
            and isinstance(message, Message)
            and isinstance(message.text, str)
            and self.should_store_message
        ):
            store_message(
                message,
                flow_id=self.graph.flow_id,
            )
            self.message.value = message

        self.status = message
        return message

data_template.info: Template to convert Data to Text. If left empty, it will be dynamically set to the Data's text key.
data_template.name: data_template

input_value.info: Message to be passed as output.
input_value.name: input_value

session_id.info: The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.
session_id.name: session_id

should_store_message.info: Store the message in the history.
should_store_message.name: should_store_message

api_key.name: api_key

import operator
from functools import reduce

from langchain_openai import ChatOpenAI
from pydantic.v1 import SecretStr

from axiestudio.base.models.model import LCModelComponent
from axiestudio.base.models.openai_constants import OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES
from axiestudio.field_typing import LanguageModel
from axiestudio.field_typing.range_spec import RangeSpec
from axiestudio.inputs import (
    BoolInput,
    DictInput,
    DropdownInput,
    FloatInput,
    IntInput,
    SecretStrInput,
    StrInput,
)
from axiestudio.inputs.inputs import HandleInput


class OpenAIModelComponent(LCModelComponent):
    display_name = "OpenAI"
    description = "Generates text using OpenAI LLMs."
    icon = "OpenAI"
    name = "OpenAIModel"

    inputs = [
        *LCModelComponent._base_inputs,
        IntInput(
            name="max_tokens",
            display_name="Max Tokens",
            advanced=True,
            info="The maximum number of tokens to generate. Set to 0 for unlimited tokens.",
            range_spec=RangeSpec(min=0, max=128000),
        ),
        DictInput(name="model_kwargs", display_name="Model Kwargs", advanced=True),
        BoolInput(
            name="json_mode",
            display_name="JSON Mode",
            advanced=True,
            info="If True, it will output JSON regardless of passing a schema.",
        ),
        DictInput(
            name="output_schema",
            is_list=True,
            display_name="Schema",
            advanced=True,
            info="The schema for the Output of the model. "
            "You must pass the word JSON in the prompt. "
            "If left blank, JSON mode will be disabled.",
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="model_name",
            display_name="Model Name",
            advanced=False,
            options=OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES,
            value=OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES[0],
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="openai_api_base",
            display_name="OpenAI API Base",
            advanced=True,
            info="The base URL of the OpenAI API. "
            "Defaults to https://api.openai.com/v1. "
            "You can change this to use other APIs like JinaChat, LocalAI and Prem.",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="api_key",
            display_name="OpenAI API Key",
            info="The OpenAI API Key to use for the OpenAI model.",
            advanced=False,
            value="OPENAI_API_KEY",
        ),
        FloatInput(name="temperature", display_name="Temperature", value=0.1),
        IntInput(
            name="seed",
            display_name="Seed",
            info="The seed controls the reproducibility of the job.",
            advanced=True,
            value=1,
        ),
        HandleInput(
            name="output_parser",
            display_name="Output Parser",
            info="The parser to use to parse the output of the model",
            advanced=True,
            input_types=["OutputParser"],
        ),
    ]

    def build_model(self) -> LanguageModel:  # type: ignore[type-var]
        # self.output_schema is a list of dictionaries
        # let's convert it to a dictionary
        output_schema_dict: dict[str, str] = reduce(operator.ior, self.output_schema or {}, {})
        openai_api_key = self.api_key
        temperature = self.temperature
        model_name: str = self.model_name
        max_tokens = self.max_tokens
        model_kwargs = self.model_kwargs or {}
        openai_api_base = self.openai_api_base or "https://api.openai.com/v1"
        json_mode = bool(output_schema_dict) or self.json_mode
        seed = self.seed

        api_key = SecretStr(openai_api_key) if openai_api_key else None
        output = ChatOpenAI(
            max_tokens=max_tokens or None,
            model_kwargs=model_kwargs,
            model=model_name,
            base_url=openai_api_base,
            api_key=api_key,
            temperature=temperature if temperature is not None else 0.1,
            seed=seed,
        )
        if json_mode:
            if output_schema_dict:
                output = output.with_structured_output(schema=output_schema_dict, method="json_mode")
            else:
                output = output.bind(response_format={"type": "json_object"})

        return output

    def _get_exception_message(self, e: Exception):
        """
        Get a message from an OpenAI exception.

        Args:
            exception (Exception): The exception to get the message from.

        Returns:
            str: The message from the exception.
        """

        try:
            from openai import BadRequestError
        except ImportError:
            return None
        if isinstance(e, BadRequestError):
            message = e.body.get("message")
            if message:
                return message
        return None

json_mode.info: If True, it will output JSON regardless of passing a schema.
json_mode.name: json_mode

max_tokens.info: The maximum number of tokens to generate. Set to 0 for unlimited tokens.
max_tokens.name: max_tokens

openai_api_base.info: The base URL of the OpenAI API. Defaults to https://api.openai.com/v1. You can change this to use other APIs like JinaChat, LocalAI and Prem.
openai_api_base.name: openai_api_base

output_parser.info: The parser to use to parse the output of the model
output_parser.name: output_parser

output_schema.info: The schema for the Output of the model. You must pass the word JSON in the prompt. If left blank, JSON mode will be disabled.
output_schema.name: output_schema

seed.info: The seed controls the reproducibility of the job.
seed.name: seed

stream.info: Stream the response from the model. Streaming works only in Chat.
stream.name: stream

system_message.info: System message to pass to the model.
system_message.name: system_message

code.value:
from typing import Optional, List

from langchain.agents import create_tool_calling_agent
from langchain_core.prompts import ChatPromptTemplate, PromptTemplate, HumanMessagePromptTemplate
from axiestudio.base.agents.agent import LCToolsAgentComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import MultilineInput
from axiestudio.inputs.inputs import HandleInput, DataInput
from axiestudio.schema import Data


class ToolCallingAgentComponent(LCToolsAgentComponent):
    display_name: str = "Tool Calling Agent"
    description: str = "Agent that uses tools"
    icon = "bot-message-square"
    beta = True
    name = "ToolCallingAgent"

    inputs = LCToolsAgentComponent._base_inputs + [
        HandleInput(name="llm", display_name="Language Model", input_types=["LanguageModel"], required=True),
        MultilineInput(
            name="system_prompt",
            display_name="System Prompt",
            info="System prompt for the agent.",
            value="You are a helpful assistant",
        ),
        MultilineInput(
            name="user_prompt", display_name="Prompt", info="This prompt must contain 'input' key.", value="{input}"
        ),
        DataInput(name="chat_history", display_name="Chat History", is_list=True, advanced=True),
    ]

    def get_chat_history_data(self) -> Optional[List[Data]]:
        return self.chat_history

    def create_agent_runnable(self):
        if "input" not in self.user_prompt:
            raise ValueError("Prompt must contain 'input' key.")
        messages = [
            ("system", self.system_prompt),
            ("placeholder", "{chat_history}"),
            HumanMessagePromptTemplate(prompt=PromptTemplate(input_variables=["input"], template=self.user_prompt)),
            ("placeholder", "{agent_scratchpad}"),
        ]
        prompt = ChatPromptTemplate.from_messages(messages)
        return create_tool_calling_agent(self.llm, self.tools, prompt)

system_prompt.name: system_prompt
system_prompt.value: You are a City Selection Expert, skilled in analyzing travel data to pick ideal destinations. Your goal is to select the best city based on weather, season, and prices. Use the provided tools to gather information and make an informed decision. Your final output should be a detailed report on the chosen city, including flight costs, weather forecasts, and attractions.

node.description: Call the searchapi.io API with result limiting

code.name: code
code.value:
from typing import Any

from langchain.tools import StructuredTool
from langchain_community.utilities.searchapi import SearchApiAPIWrapper
from pydantic import BaseModel, Field

from axiestudio.base.langchain_utilities.model import LCToolComponent
from axiestudio.field_typing import Tool
from axiestudio.inputs import DictInput, IntInput, MessageTextInput, MultilineInput, SecretStrInput
from axiestudio.schema import Data


class SearchAPIComponent(LCToolComponent):
    display_name: str = "Search API"
    description: str = "Call the searchapi.io API with result limiting"
    name = "SearchAPI"
    documentation: str = "https://www.searchapi.io/docs/google"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(name="engine", display_name="Engine", value="google"),
        SecretStrInput(name="api_key", display_name="SearchAPI API Key", required=True),
        MultilineInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Input",
        ),
        DictInput(name="search_params", display_name="Search parameters", advanced=True, is_list=True),
        IntInput(name="max_results", display_name="Max Results", value=5, advanced=True),
        IntInput(name="max_snippet_length", display_name="Max Snippet Length", value=100, advanced=True),
    ]

    class SearchAPISchema(BaseModel):
        query: str = Field(..., description="The search query")
        params: dict[str, Any] | None = Field(default_factory=dict, description="Additional search parameters")
        max_results: int = Field(5, description="Maximum number of results to return")
        max_snippet_length: int = Field(100, description="Maximum length of each result snippet")

    def _build_wrapper(self):
        return SearchApiAPIWrapper(engine=self.engine, searchapi_api_key=self.api_key)

    def build_tool(self) -> Tool:
        wrapper = self._build_wrapper()

        def search_func(
            query: str, params: dict[str, Any] | None = None, max_results: int = 5, max_snippet_length: int = 100
        ) -> list[dict[str, Any]]:
            params = params or {}
            full_results = wrapper.results(query=query, **params)
            organic_results = full_results.get("organic_results", [])[:max_results]

            limited_results = []
            for result in organic_results:
                limited_result = {
                    "title": result.get("title", "")[:max_snippet_length],
                    "link": result.get("link", ""),
                    "snippet": result.get("snippet", "")[:max_snippet_length],
                }
                limited_results.append(limited_result)

            return limited_results

        tool = StructuredTool.from_function(
            name="search_api",
            description="Search for recent results using searchapi.io with result limiting",
            func=search_func,
            args_schema=self.SearchAPISchema,
        )

        self.status = f"Search API Tool created with engine: {self.engine}"
        return tool

    def run_model(self) -> list[Data]:
        tool = self.build_tool()
        results = tool.run(
            {
                "query": self.input_value,
                "params": self.search_params or {},
                "max_results": self.max_results,
                "max_snippet_length": self.max_snippet_length,
            }
        )

        data_list = [Data(data=result, text=result.get("snippet", "")) for result in results]

        self.status = data_list
        return data_list

node.description: Fetch content from a single URL.

code.name: code
code.value:
from typing import Union, Optional
from langchain_community.document_loaders.web_base import WebBaseLoader
from axiestudio.base.langchain_utilities.model import LCToolComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import MessageTextInput, DictInput
from axiestudio.schema import Data
from axiestudio.field_typing import Tool
from langchain.tools import StructuredTool
from pydantic import BaseModel, Field

class URLToolComponent(LCToolComponent):
    display_name: str = "URL Content Fetcher"
    description: str = "Fetch content from a single URL."
    name = "url_content_fetcher"
    documentation: str = "https://python.langchain.com/docs/modules/data_connection/document_loaders/integrations/web_base"
    icon="globe"
    
    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="url",
            display_name="URL",
            info="Enter a single URL to fetch content from.",
        ),
        DictInput(name="fetch_params", display_name="Fetch parameters", advanced=True, is_list=True),
    ]

    class URLContentFetcherSchema(BaseModel):
        url: str = Field(..., description="The URL to fetch content from")
        fetch_params: Optional[dict] = Field(default=None, description="Additional parameters for fetching")

    def run_model(self) -> Union[Data, list[Data]]:
        wrapper = self._build_wrapper()
        content = wrapper.load()[0]
        data = Data(data={"content": content.page_content, "metadata": content.metadata}, 
                    text=content.page_content[:500])
        self.status = data
        return data

    def build_tool(self) -> Tool:
        return StructuredTool.from_function(
            name="url_content_fetcher",
            description="Fetch content from a single URL. Input should be a URL string only.",
            func=self._fetch_url_content,
            args_schema=self.URLContentFetcherSchema,
        )

    def _build_wrapper(self):
        return WebBaseLoader(web_paths=[self.url], encoding="utf-8", **self.fetch_params or {})

    def _fetch_url_content(self, url: str, fetch_params: Optional[dict] = None) -> dict:
        loader = WebBaseLoader(web_paths=[url], encoding="utf-8", **(fetch_params or {}))
        content = loader.load()[0]
        return {
            "content": content.page_content,
            "metadata": content.metadata
        }

url.info: Enter a single URL to fetch content from.
url.name: url

from typing import Optional, List

from langchain.agents import create_tool_calling_agent
from langchain_core.prompts import ChatPromptTemplate, PromptTemplate, HumanMessagePromptTemplate
from axiestudio.base.agents.agent import LCToolsAgentComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import MultilineInput
from axiestudio.inputs.inputs import HandleInput, DataInput
from axiestudio.schema import Data


class ToolCallingAgentComponent(LCToolsAgentComponent):
    display_name: str = "Tool Calling Agent"

    name = "ToolCallingAgent"

    inputs = LCToolsAgentComponent._base_inputs + [
        HandleInput(name="llm", display_name="Language Model", input_types=["LanguageModel"], required=True),
        MultilineInput(

        ),
        DataInput(name="chat_history", display_name="Chat History", is_list=True, advanced=True),

    def get_chat_history_data(self) -> Optional[List[Data]]:

    def create_agent_runnable(self):

            ("placeholder", "{chat_history}"),

        prompt = ChatPromptTemplate.from_messages(messages)
        return create_tool_calling_agent(self.llm, self.tools, prompt)

Compile an in-depth guide for travelers, including key attractions, local customs, special events, and daily activity recommendations. Focus on hidden gems and local hotspots. Your final output should be a comprehensive city guide, rich in cultural insights and practical tips.

system_prompt.name: system_prompt
system_prompt.value: You are an Amazing Travel Concierge, a specialist in travel planning and logistics with decades of experience. Your goal is to create the most amazing travel itineraries with budget and packing suggestions for the city. Expand the city guide into a full 7-day travel itinerary with detailed per-day plans. Include weather forecasts, places to eat, packing suggestions, and a budget breakdown. Suggest actual places to visit, hotels to stay, and restaurants to go to. Your final output should be a complete expanded travel plan, formatted as markdown, encompassing a daily schedule, anticipated weather conditions, recommended clothing and items to pack, and a detailed budget.

node.description: Get chat inputs from the Playground.

code.name: code
code.value:
from axiestudio.base.data.utils import IMG_FILE_TYPES, TEXT_FILE_TYPES
from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import BoolInput
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, FileInput, MessageTextInput, MultilineInput, Output
from axiestudio.memory import store_message
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.utils.constants import MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_USER, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER


class ChatInput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Input"
    description = "Get chat inputs from the Playground."
    icon = "ChatInput"
    name = "ChatInput"

    inputs = [
        MultilineInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            value="",
            info="Message to be passed as input.",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="should_store_message",
            display_name="Store Messages",
            info="Store the message in the history.",
            value=True,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=[MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER],
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_USER,
            info="Type of sender.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name",
            display_name="Sender Name",
            info="Name of the sender.",
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_USER,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id",
            display_name="Session ID",
            info="The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        FileInput(
            name="files",
            display_name="Files",
            file_types=TEXT_FILE_TYPES + IMG_FILE_TYPES,
            info="Files to be sent with the message.",
            advanced=True,
            is_list=True,
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Message", name="message", method="message_response"),
    ]

    def message_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
            sender=self.sender,
            sender_name=self.sender_name,
            session_id=self.session_id,
            files=self.files,
        )

        if (
            self.session_id
            and isinstance(message, Message)
            and isinstance(message.text, str)
            and self.should_store_message
        ):
            store_message(
                message,
                flow_id=self.graph.flow_id,
            )
            self.message.value = message

        self.status = message
        return message

files.info: Files to be sent with the message.
files.name: files

input_value.info: Message to be passed as input.
input_value.name: input_value
input_value.value: Create a travel itinerary for a trip from São Paulo to Uberlândia, MG on August 23, 2024. The traveler enjoys drinking beer, eating pão de queijo, and drinking special coffee.

node.description: Display a chat message in the Playground.

code.name: code
code.value:
from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import BoolInput
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.memory import store_message
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.utils.constants import MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER


class ChatOutput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Output"
    description = "Display a chat message in the Playground."
    icon = "ChatOutput"
    name = "ChatOutput"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            info="Message to be passed as output.",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="should_store_message",
            display_name="Store Messages",
            info="Store the message in the history.",
            value=True,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=[MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER],
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_AI,
            advanced=True,
            info="Type of sender.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name",
            display_name="Sender Name",
            info="Name of the sender.",
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_AI,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id",
            display_name="Session ID",
            info="The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="data_template",
            display_name="Data Template",
            value="{text}",
            advanced=True,
            info="Template to convert Data to Text. If left empty, it will be dynamically set to the Data's text key.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Message", name="message", method="message_response"),
    ]

    def message_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
            sender=self.sender,
            sender_name=self.sender_name,
            session_id=self.session_id,
        )
        if (
            self.session_id
            and isinstance(message, Message)
            and isinstance(message.text, str)
            and self.should_store_message
        ):
            store_message(
                message,
                flow_id=self.graph.flow_id,
            )
            self.message.value = message

        self.status = message
        return message

data_template.info: Template to convert Data to Text. If left empty, it will be dynamically set to the Data's text key.
data_template.name: data_template

input_value.info: Message to be passed as output.
input_value.name: input_value

session_id.info: The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.
session_id.name: session_id

should_store_message.info: Store the message in the history.
should_store_message.name: should_store_message

api_key.name: api_key

code.value:
import operator
from functools import reduce

from langchain_openai import ChatOpenAI
from pydantic.v1 import SecretStr

from axiestudio.base.models.model import LCModelComponent
from axiestudio.base.models.openai_constants import OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES
from axiestudio.field_typing import LanguageModel
from axiestudio.field_typing.range_spec import RangeSpec
from axiestudio.inputs import (
    BoolInput,
    DictInput,
    DropdownInput,
    FloatInput,
    IntInput,
    SecretStrInput,
    StrInput,
)
from axiestudio.inputs.inputs import HandleInput


class OpenAIModelComponent(LCModelComponent):
    display_name = "OpenAI"
    description = "Generates text using OpenAI LLMs."
    icon = "OpenAI"
    name = "OpenAIModel"

    inputs = [
        *LCModelComponent._base_inputs,
        IntInput(
            name="max_tokens",
            display_name="Max Tokens",
            advanced=True,
            info="The maximum number of tokens to generate. Set to 0 for unlimited tokens.",
            range_spec=RangeSpec(min=0, max=128000),
        ),
        DictInput(name="model_kwargs", display_name="Model Kwargs", advanced=True),
        BoolInput(
            name="json_mode",
            display_name="JSON Mode",
            advanced=True,
            info="If True, it will output JSON regardless of passing a schema.",
        ),
        DictInput(
            name="output_schema",
            is_list=True,
            display_name="Schema",
            advanced=True,
            info="The schema for the Output of the model. "
            "You must pass the word JSON in the prompt. "
            "If left blank, JSON mode will be disabled.",
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="model_name",
            display_name="Model Name",
            advanced=False,
            options=OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES,
            value=OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES[0],
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="openai_api_base",
            display_name="OpenAI API Base",
            advanced=True,
            info="The base URL of the OpenAI API. "
            "Defaults to https://api.openai.com/v1. "
            "You can change this to use other APIs like JinaChat, LocalAI and Prem.",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="api_key",
            display_name="OpenAI API Key",
            info="The OpenAI API Key to use for the OpenAI model.",
            advanced=False,
            value="OPENAI_API_KEY",
        ),
        FloatInput(name="temperature", display_name="Temperature", value=0.1),
        IntInput(
            name="seed",
            display_name="Seed",
            info="The seed controls the reproducibility of the job.",
            advanced=True,
            value=1,
        ),
        HandleInput(
            name="output_parser",
            display_name="Output Parser",
            info="The parser to use to parse the output of the model",
            advanced=True,
            input_types=["OutputParser"],
        ),
    ]

    def build_model(self) -> LanguageModel:  # type: ignore[type-var]
        # self.output_schema is a list of dictionaries
        # let's convert it to a dictionary
        output_schema_dict: dict[str, str] = reduce(operator.ior, self.output_schema or {}, {})
        openai_api_key = self.api_key
        temperature = self.temperature
        model_name: str = self.model_name
        max_tokens = self.max_tokens
        model_kwargs = self.model_kwargs or {}
        openai_api_base = self.openai_api_base or "https://api.openai.com/v1"
        json_mode = bool(output_schema_dict) or self.json_mode
        seed = self.seed

        api_key = SecretStr(openai_api_key) if openai_api_key else None
        output = ChatOpenAI(
            max_tokens=max_tokens or None,
            model_kwargs=model_kwargs,
            model=model_name,
            base_url=openai_api_base,
            api_key=api_key,
            temperature=temperature if temperature is not None else 0.1,
            seed=seed,
        )
        if json_mode:
            if output_schema_dict:
                output = output.with_structured_output(schema=output_schema_dict, method="json_mode")
            else:
                output = output.bind(response_format={"type": "json_object"})

        return output

    def _get_exception_message(self, e: Exception):
        """
        Get a message from an OpenAI exception.

        Args:
            exception (Exception): The exception to get the message from.

        Returns:
            str: The message from the exception.
        """

        try:
            from openai import BadRequestError
        except ImportError:
            return None
        if isinstance(e, BadRequestError):
            message = e.body.get("message")
            if message:
                return message
        return None

json_mode.info: If True, it will output JSON regardless of passing a schema.
json_mode.name: json_mode

max_tokens.info: The maximum number of tokens to generate. Set to 0 for unlimited tokens.
max_tokens.name: max_tokens

openai_api_base.info: The base URL of the OpenAI API. Defaults to https://api.openai.com/v1. You can change this to use other APIs like JinaChat, LocalAI and Prem.
openai_api_base.name: openai_api_base

output_parser.info: The parser to use to parse the output of the model
output_parser.name: output_parser

output_schema.info: The schema for the Output of the model. You must pass the word JSON in the prompt. If left blank, JSON mode will be disabled.
output_schema.name: output_schema

seed.info: The seed controls the reproducibility of the job.
seed.name: seed

stream.info: Stream the response from the model. Streaming works only in Chat.
stream.name: stream

system_message.info: System message to pass to the model.
system_message.name: system_message

from typing import Optional, List

from langchain.agents import create_tool_calling_agent
from langchain_core.prompts import ChatPromptTemplate, PromptTemplate, HumanMessagePromptTemplate
from axiestudio.base.agents.agent import LCToolsAgentComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import MultilineInput
from axiestudio.inputs.inputs import HandleInput, DataInput
from axiestudio.schema import Data


class ToolCallingAgentComponent(LCToolsAgentComponent):
    display_name: str = "Tool Calling Agent"
    description: str = "Agent that uses tools"
    icon = "bot-message-square"
    beta = True
    name = "ToolCallingAgent"

    inputs = LCToolsAgentComponent._base_inputs + [
        HandleInput(name="llm", display_name="Language Model", input_types=["LanguageModel"], required=True),
        MultilineInput(
            name="system_prompt",
            display_name="System Prompt",
            info="System prompt for the agent.",
            value="You are a helpful assistant",
        ),
        MultilineInput(
            name="user_prompt", display_name="Prompt", info="This prompt must contain 'input' key.", value="{input}"
        ),
        DataInput(name="chat_history", display_name="Chat History", is_list=True, advanced=True),
    ]

    def get_chat_history_data(self) -> Optional[List[Data]]:
        return self.chat_history

    def create_agent_runnable(self):
        if "input" not in self.user_prompt:
            raise ValueError("Prompt must contain 'input' key.")
        messages = [
            ("system", self.system_prompt),
            ("placeholder", "{chat_history}"),
            HumanMessagePromptTemplate(prompt=PromptTemplate(input_variables=["input"], template=self.user_prompt)),
            ("placeholder", "{agent_scratchpad}"),
        ]
        prompt = ChatPromptTemplate.from_messages(messages)
        return create_tool_calling_agent(self.llm, self.tools, prompt)

system_prompt.name: system_prompt
system_prompt.value: You are a City Selection Expert, skilled in analyzing travel data to pick ideal destinations. Your goal is to select the best city based on weather, season, and prices. Use the provided tools to gather information and make an informed decision. Your final output should be a detailed report on the chosen city, including flight costs, weather forecasts, and attractions.

node.description: Call the searchapi.io API with result limiting

code.name: code
code.value:
from typing import Any

from langchain.tools import StructuredTool
from langchain_community.utilities.searchapi import SearchApiAPIWrapper
from pydantic import BaseModel, Field

from axiestudio.base.langchain_utilities.model import LCToolComponent
from axiestudio.field_typing import Tool
from axiestudio.inputs import DictInput, IntInput, MessageTextInput, MultilineInput, SecretStrInput
from axiestudio.schema import Data


class SearchAPIComponent(LCToolComponent):
    display_name: str = "Search API"
    description: str = "Call the searchapi.io API with result limiting"
    name = "SearchAPI"
    documentation: str = "https://www.searchapi.io/docs/google"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(name="engine", display_name="Engine", value="google"),
        SecretStrInput(name="api_key", display_name="SearchAPI API Key", required=True),
        MultilineInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Input",
        ),
        DictInput(name="search_params", display_name="Search parameters", advanced=True, is_list=True),
        IntInput(name="max_results", display_name="Max Results", value=5, advanced=True),
        IntInput(name="max_snippet_length", display_name="Max Snippet Length", value=100, advanced=True),
    ]

    class SearchAPISchema(BaseModel):
        query: str = Field(..., description="The search query")
        params: dict[str, Any] | None = Field(default_factory=dict, description="Additional search parameters")
        max_results: int = Field(5, description="Maximum number of results to return")
        max_snippet_length: int = Field(100, description="Maximum length of each result snippet")

    def _build_wrapper(self):
        return SearchApiAPIWrapper(engine=self.engine, searchapi_api_key=self.api_key)

    def build_tool(self) -> Tool:
        wrapper = self._build_wrapper()

        def search_func(
            query: str, params: dict[str, Any] | None = None, max_results: int = 5, max_snippet_length: int = 100
        ) -> list[dict[str, Any]]:
            params = params or {}
            full_results = wrapper.results(query=query, **params)
            organic_results = full_results.get("organic_results", [])[:max_results]

            limited_results = []
            for result in organic_results:
                limited_result = {
                    "title": result.get("title", "")[:max_snippet_length],
                    "link": result.get("link", ""),
                    "snippet": result.get("snippet", "")[:max_snippet_length],
                }
                limited_results.append(limited_result)

            return limited_results

        tool = StructuredTool.from_function(
            name="search_api",
            description="Search for recent results using searchapi.io with result limiting",
            func=search_func,
            args_schema=self.SearchAPISchema,
        )

        self.status = f"Search API Tool created with engine: {self.engine}"
        return tool

    def run_model(self) -> list[Data]:
        tool = self.build_tool()
        results = tool.run(
            {
                "query": self.input_value,
                "params": self.search_params or {},
                "max_results": self.max_results,
                "max_snippet_length": self.max_snippet_length,
            }
        )

        data_list = [Data(data=result, text=result.get("snippet", "")) for result in results]

        self.status = data_list
        return data_list

node.description: Fetch content from a single URL.

code.name: code
code.value:
from typing import Union, Optional
from langchain_community.document_loaders.web_base import WebBaseLoader
from axiestudio.base.langchain_utilities.model import LCToolComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import MessageTextInput, DictInput
from axiestudio.schema import Data
from axiestudio.field_typing import Tool
from langchain.tools import StructuredTool
from pydantic import BaseModel, Field

class URLToolComponent(LCToolComponent):
    display_name: str = "URL Content Fetcher"
    description: str = "Fetch content from a single URL."
    name = "url_content_fetcher"
    documentation: str = "https://python.langchain.com/docs/modules/data_connection/document_loaders/integrations/web_base"
    icon="globe"
    
    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="url",
            display_name="URL",
            info="Enter a single URL to fetch content from.",
        ),
        DictInput(name="fetch_params", display_name="Fetch parameters", advanced=True, is_list=True),
    ]

    class URLContentFetcherSchema(BaseModel):
        url: str = Field(..., description="The URL to fetch content from")
        fetch_params: Optional[dict] = Field(default=None, description="Additional parameters for fetching")

    def run_model(self) -> Union[Data, list[Data]]:
        wrapper = self._build_wrapper()
        content = wrapper.load()[0]
        data = Data(data={"content": content.page_content, "metadata": content.metadata}, 
                    text=content.page_content[:500])
        self.status = data
        return data

    def build_tool(self) -> Tool:
        return StructuredTool.from_function(
            name="url_content_fetcher",
            description="Fetch content from a single URL. Input should be a URL string only.",
            func=self._fetch_url_content,
            args_schema=self.URLContentFetcherSchema,
        )

    def _build_wrapper(self):
        return WebBaseLoader(web_paths=[self.url], encoding="utf-8", **self.fetch_params or {})

    def _fetch_url_content(self, url: str, fetch_params: Optional[dict] = None) -> dict:
        loader = WebBaseLoader(web_paths=[url], encoding="utf-8", **(fetch_params or {}))
        content = loader.load()[0]
        return {
            "content": content.page_content,
            "metadata": content.metadata
        }

url.info: Enter a single URL to fetch content from.
url.name: url

from typing import Optional, List

from langchain.agents import create_tool_calling_agent
from langchain_core.prompts import ChatPromptTemplate, PromptTemplate, HumanMessagePromptTemplate
from axiestudio.base.agents.agent import LCToolsAgentComponent

class ToolCallingAgentComponent(LCToolsAgentComponent):

system_prompt.name: system_prompt
system_prompt.value: You are an Amazing Travel Concierge, a specialist in travel planning and logistics with decades of experience. Your goal is to create the most amazing travel itineraries with budget and packing suggestions for the city. Expand the city guide into a full 7-day travel itinerary with detailed per-day plans. Include weather forecasts, places to eat, packing suggestions, and a budget breakdown. Suggest actual places to visit, hotels to stay, and restaurants to go to. Your final output should be a complete expanded travel plan, formatted as markdown, encompassing a daily schedule, anticipated weather conditions, recommended clothing and items to pack, and a detailed budget.
